issue.title: Add support for multiple sites

repository.name: owasp-zap-glue-ci-images
repository.description: Ready to use images of Zap and Glue, especially for CI integration.

issue.body:
When scanning multiple sites via Zap, Zap generate alerts per site in the following format: ``` { "@version": "2.7.0", "@generated": "Thu, 27 Dec 2018 10:34:14", "site": [ { "@name": "http://encryptor:9999", "@host": "encryptor", "@port": "9999", "@ssl": "false", "alerts": [ { "pluginid": "50001", "alert": "Resource Allows Anonymous Access", "name": "Resource Allows Anonymous Access", "riskcode": "1", "confidence": "2", "riskdesc": "Low (Medium)", "desc": "

The web/application server allowed access without any Authorization header on the request.<\/p>", "instances": [ { "uri": "http: //encryptor:9999/api/v1/encrypt", "method": "POST" } ], "count": "1", "solution": "

Ensure that the application appropriately requires authentication and authorization.<\/p>", "reference": "

<\/p>", "sourceid": "3" } ] }, { "@name": "http: //decryptor: 9999", "@host": "decryptor", "@port": "9999", "@ssl": "false", "alerts": [] } ] } ``` Currently this is not supported by the JQ pattern so the parse failed and the tests are not running. Also, due to zaproxy/zaproxy#5162, the report format is inconsistent - so until this bug is fixed we need to support both formats.

issue.title: Use always an array for sites in JSON report

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change ReportGenerator to use an array (if not already) for the site
entry.

Fix #5162 - Inconsistent JSON report format

issue.title: Mention breaking change in JSON report

repository.name: zap-core-help
repository.description: The help files for the ZAP core

issue.body:
Update release notes to mention the change in the JSON report, the
`site` property will always by an array.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#5162 - Inconsistent JSON report format

body: Damn you're fast! I thought to write it down last night but didn't have time to do that :) Thanks!

:) It we'll be released on Wednesday, right? As part of the weekly image?
Does the raw image also release weekly? I

The weekly is usually released on Mondays - that should be available this morning, and yet that will include this fix.
Which raw image are you referring to? The 'bare' image is just for full ZAP releases, ie its still on 2.7.0
Yes, sorry. Can I add a weekly bare image? What do you think?
Maybe yes when we automate the builds better? Thats in progress but no eta
Ok, I'll use the weekly image for now. Thanks :)

issue.title: Add support for multiple sites in Zap report

repository.name: owasp-zap-glue-ci-images
repository.description: Ready to use images of Zap and Glue, especially for CI integration.

issue.body:
Added support for the bug fix zaproxy/zaproxy#5162
close #4

issue.title: fix zap JQ pattern
issue.body: After fixing the issue zaproxy/zaproxy#5162, the JSON report format has changed. This PR update the JQ pattern to support the new format (thanks @lech1991 for pointing it out! - #152).

issue.title: ZAP failing with: Supported versions = 2.4.0 and up - got 2.8.0
issue.body:
For both docker and installed glue fails to use ZAP:

```
~# docker run --network="host" owasp/glue -t zap --zap-host http://127.0.0.1 --zap-port 8080 http://127.0.0.1:3000
Loading scanner...
Logfile nil?
calling scan
Running scanner
Mounting http://127.0.0.1:3000 with #<Glue::URLMounter:0x000000025f0198>
Mounted http://127.0.0.1:3000 with #<Glue::URLMounter:0x000000025f0198>
Processing target...http://127.0.0.1:3000
Running tasks in stage: wait
Running tasks in stage: mount
Running tasks in stage: file
Running tasks in stage: code
Running tasks in stage: live
Install ZAP from owasp.org and ensure that the configuration to connect is correct.  Supported versions = 2.4.0 and up - got 2.8.0
Running tasks in stage: done
Running base report...


~/glue# ruby bin/glue -t zap --zap-host http://localhost --zap-port 8080 http://localhost:3000
Logfile nil?
calling scan
Running scanner
Loading scanner...
Mounting http://127.0.0.1:3000 with #<Glue::URLMounter:0x000055ea8d0de2b0>
Mounted http://127.0.0.1:3000 with #<Glue::URLMounter:0x000055ea8d0de2b0>
Processing target...http://127.0.0.1:3000
Running tasks in stage: wait
Running tasks in stage: mount
Running tasks in stage: file
Running tasks in stage: code
Running tasks in stage: live
Install ZAP from owasp.org and ensure that the configuration to connect is correct.  Supported versions = 2.4.0 and up - got 2.8.0
Running tasks in stage: done
Running base report...
```

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
